definition: round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Today, a doughboy or GI may be called a grunt.
sentences.chinese: 今天，一个团子或者GI可能会被称为咕噜。

sentences.english: Dampen hands and form meat mixture into a palm-sized patty.
sentences.chinese: 手弄湿后，将肉糜揉成巴掌大团子。

sentences.english: I like the heavy greasy foods like hamburgers and fried dumplings .
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢油脂很重的食物，例如汉堡包和炸团子。

sentences.english: A smooth curdled "milk lump" has soon be rolled after several moves;
sentences.chinese: 一个光滑的牛奶团子很快就被揉了出来。

sentences.english: The dumplings lay heavy on his stomach.
sentences.chinese: 那些团子使他肚子胀得难受。

sentences.english: Zongzi is a pyramid-shaped dumpling made of glutinous rice wrapped in bamboo or reed leaves.
sentences.chinese: 粽子是一种由竹叶或芦苇叶包成塔形的糯米团子。

definition: boiled balls of glutinous rice flour, eaten during the Lantern Festival
nian gao, New Year cake, typically a sweet, steamed cake made with glutinous rice flour
rice ball (steamed rice formed into a ball and stuffed with various fillings)/onigiri (Japanese-style rice ball)
thick paste of fermented soybean/marinated in soy paste/paste/jam
